speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: SCENE I. Before the house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus, DROMIO of Ephesus, ANGELO, and BALTHAZAR

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Good Signior Angelo, you must excuse us all;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: My wife is shrewish when I keep not hours:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Say that I linger'd with you at your shop

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To see the making of her carcanet,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And that to-morrow you will bring it home.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But here's a villain that would face me down

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: He met me on the mart, and that I beat him,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And charged him with a thousand marks in gold,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And that I did deny my wife and house.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Thou drunkard, thou, what didst thou mean by this?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Say what you will, sir, but I know what I know;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That you beat me at the mart, I have your hand to show:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: If the skin were parchment, and the blows you gave were ink,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Your own handwriting would tell you what I think.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I think thou art an ass.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Marry, so it doth appear

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: By the wrongs I suffer and the blows I bear.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I should kick, being kick'd; and, being at that pass,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You would keep from my heels and beware of an ass.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You're sad, Signior Balthazar: pray God our cheer

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: May answer my good will and your good welcome here.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: I hold your dainties cheap, sir, and your

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: welcome dear.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: O, Signior Balthazar, either at flesh or fish,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: A table full of welcome make scarce one dainty dish.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Good meat, sir, is common; that every churl affords.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And welcome more common; for that's nothing but words.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Small cheer and great welcome makes a merry feast.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Ay, to a niggardly host, and more sparing guest:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But though my cates be mean, take them in good part;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Better cheer may you have, but not with better heart.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But, soft! my door is lock'd. Go bid them let us in.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Maud, Bridget, Marian, Cicel, Gillian, Ginn!

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  Mome, malt-horse, capon, coxcomb,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: idiot, patch!

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Either get thee from the door, or sit down at the hatch.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Dost thou conjure for wenches, that thou call'st

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: for such store,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: When one is one too many? Go, get thee from the door.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: What patch is made our porter? My master stays in

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: the street.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  Let him walk from whence he came, lest he

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: catch cold on's feet.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Who talks within there? ho, open the door!

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  Right, sir; I'll tell you when, an you tell

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: me wherefore.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Wherefore? for my dinner: I have not dined to-day.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  Nor to-day here you must not; come again

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: when you may.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: What art thou that keepest me out from the house I owe?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  The porter for this time, sir, and my name

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: is Dromio.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: O villain! thou hast stolen both mine office and my name.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: The one ne'er got me credit, the other mickle blame.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: If thou hadst been Dromio to-day in my place,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Thou wouldst have changed thy face for a name or thy

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: name for an ass.

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: [Within]  What a coil is there, Dromio? who are those

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: at the gate?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Let my master in, Luce.

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: [Within]  Faith, no; he comes too late;

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: And so tell your master.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: O Lord, I must laugh!

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Have at you with a proverb--Shall I set in my staff?

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: [Within]  Have at you with another; that's--When?

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: can you tell?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  If thy name be call'd Luce--Luce, thou hast

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: answered him well.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS
text_entry: Do you hear, you minion? you'll let us in, I hope?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS
text_entry: OF EPHESUS

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: [Within]  I thought to have asked you.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  And you said no.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: So, come, help: well struck! there was blow for blow.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Thou baggage, let me in.

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: [Within]  Can you tell for whose sake?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Master, knock the door hard.

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: [Within]  Let him knock till it ache.

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You'll cry for this, minion, if I beat the door down.

speaker: LUCE
text_entry: [Within]  What needs all that, and a pair of stocks in the town?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: [Within]  Who is that at the door that keeps all

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: this noise?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  By my troth, your town is troubled with

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: unruly boys.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Are you there, wife? you might have come before.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: [Within]  Your wife, sir knave! go get you from the door.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: If you went in pain, master, this 'knave' would go sore.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Here is neither cheer, sir, nor welcome: we would

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: fain have either.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: In debating which was best, we shall part with neither.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: They stand at the door, master; bid them welcome hither.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: There is something in the wind, that we cannot get in.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You would say so, master, if your garments were thin.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Your cake there is warm within; you stand here in the cold:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: It would make a man mad as a buck, to be so bought and sold.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Go fetch me something: I'll break ope the gate.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  Break any breaking here, and I'll break your

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: knave's pate.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: A man may break a word with you, sir, and words are but wind,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Ay, and break it in your face, so he break it not behind.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  It seems thou want'st breaking: out upon

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: thee, hind!

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Here's too much 'out upon thee!' I pray thee,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: let me in.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: [Within]  Ay, when fowls have no feathers and fish have no fin.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Well, I'll break in: go borrow me a crow.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: A crow without feather? Master, mean you so?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: For a fish without a fin, there's a fowl without a feather;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: If a crow help us in, sirrah, we'll pluck a crow together.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Go get thee gone; fetch me an iron crow.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Have patience, sir; O, let it not be so!

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Herein you war against your reputation

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: And draw within the compass of suspect

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: The unviolated honour of your wife.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Once this,--your long experience of her wisdom,

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Her sober virtue, years and modesty,

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Plead on her part some cause to you unknown:

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: And doubt not, sir, but she will well excuse

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Why at this time the doors are made against you.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Be ruled by me: depart in patience,

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: And let us to the Tiger all to dinner,

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: And about evening come yourself alone

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: To know the reason of this strange restraint.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: If by strong hand you offer to break in

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Now in the stirring passage of the day,

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: A vulgar comment will be made of it,

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: And that supposed by the common rout

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: Against your yet ungalled estimation

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: That may with foul intrusion enter in

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: And dwell upon your grave when you are dead;

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: For slander lives upon succession,

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: For ever housed where it gets possession.

speaker: BALTHAZAR
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You have prevailed: I will depart in quiet,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And, in despite of mirth, mean to be merry.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I know a wench of excellent discourse,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Pretty and witty; wild, and yet, too, gentle:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: There will we dine. This woman that I mean,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: My wife--but, I protest, without desert--

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Hath oftentimes upbraided me withal:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To her will we to dinner.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To Angelo

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Get you home

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And fetch the chain; by this I know 'tis made:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Bring it, I pray you, to the Porpentine;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: For there's the house: that chain will I bestow--

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Be it for nothing but to spite my wife--

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Upon mine hostess there: good sir, make haste.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Since mine own doors refuse to entertain me,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I'll knock elsewhere, to see if they'll disdain me.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I'll meet you at that place some hour hence.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Do so. This jest shall cost me some expense.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Exeunt
